h2. scen_gen: an example of C++ client

h4. Short characteristics:
* uses gSoap for automatic generation of headers and DTOs (Data Transfer Objects)
* uses a WS to get the SMS of the tiny test model (id == 71)
* the SMS is stored in the automatically generated DTOs
* prints the DTO to stdout

h4. Files

* main.cpp: a simple client, will be replaced by real applications 
* stdsoap2.h, stdsoap2.cpp,typemap.dat: from gsoap 
* enrimaSoap11.nsmap,enrima.h,soapH.h, soapC.cpp, soapStub.h, soapenrimaSoap11Proxy.h, soapenrimaSoap11Proxy.cpp: generated by gsoap

h4. About gSoap
* The gSOAP toolkit is an open source C and C++ software development toolkit for SOAP/XML Web services and generic (non-SOAP) C/C++ XML data bindings. The toolkit analyzes WSDLs and XML schemas (separately or as a combined set) and maps the XML schema types and the SOAP messaging protocols to easy-to-use and efficient C and C++ code.

h4. Install gSoap
* download gsoap from http://sourceforge.net/projects/gsoap2/files/gSOAP/, please select gsoap_2.8.3.zip or above
* unzip and install gsoap (assume you unzip it to $HOME/gsoap-2.8)
* install gSoap:
  $cd $HOME/gsoap-2.8 
  $./configure --prefix=$HOME/gsoap && make && make install
  
h4. Generates headers and DTOs
* create project scen_gen:
  $mkdir scen_gen 
  $cp $HOME/gsoap-2.8 /gsoap/{typemap.dat,stdsoap2.{h,cpp}} scen_gen
* generate enrima.h 
  $HOME/bin/wsdl2h -o enrima.h -t typemap.dat http://www.ime.iiasa.ac.at/enrima_ws_tst1/enrima.wsdl
* generate DTOs
  $HOME/bin/soapcpp2 -Cx -i enrima.h -I $HOME/gsoap/share/gsoap/import/

h4. Compile and run
* linux: $g++ -o enrima *.cpp or unix: $g++ -o enrima *.cpp -lsocket -lnsl 
* ./enrima
  

h4. Documentation is available in the enrima-dev4/kernel/docs directory
